original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 296.75/297.25 to dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed slightly weaker at 296.75 /297.25 against the US dollar in the spot market on Monday, while bond yields were steady, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 296.00 /297.50 to the US dollar on Friday after opening around 302.80/303.10 rupees.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 closed at 26.50/65 percent steady from Friday’s close at 26.30/65 percent.
Sri Lanka’s rupee is appreciating amid negative private credit which has reduced outflows after the central bank hiked rates and stopped printing money. (Colombo/ May 29/2023)
